title: (x) Awards - Koch Antiqua {Mark S}
content:
I was hoping someone knew this one right off.   
   
Thanks. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230927im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32866.jpg)

 [‹ Can anyone tell me what font this is?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230927/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4176 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Ben&Jerry's font - Severance (proprietary) {Franz, Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230927/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4105 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: It's Koch Antiqua Bold. Linotype has the [regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230927/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/koch-antiqua/koch-antiqua/testdrive.html?s=Awards&p=48), but not the bold. There are other versions with the bold such as [Eva Antiqua Heavy SG](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230927/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/eva-sg/eva-antiqua-hv-sg/testdrive.html?s=Awards&p=48) and [Kuenstler 165 BT Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230927/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/kuenstler-165/kuenstler165-bt-bold/testdrive.html?s=Awards&p=48).

And if font quality is not a big issue (like for a personal project), David   
Rakowski digitized this for the Mac as [Lilith](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230927/http:/www.erik.co.uk/font/serif.html) years ago. It's only saving   
grace is that it's free.   
   
The PC conversion is all over the Web ... like [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230927/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/rakowski/dr4/davy_f4.htm).
